name: Le Monde Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: 18 - 30 Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do NOT stay at this hotel if you like a quiet life. Pre dinner drink at 7-30pm was incredible. Met with a wall of sound, knowhere to sit, tables reserved for non residents - absolute bedlam. Food is pub fare.Awoken at 3am by a drunk who set general alarm off.
reviews.title: A wee gem!
All you need for a great night
reviews.text: Great hotel if you like to party hard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in many a hotel on my travels, some have been terrible and some outstanding! This little gem certainly falls into the latter.
reviews.title: Overpriced and pretencious

likes.disliked: — Everything from room to the staff and most of all the rip off price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked and stayed at Le Monde in early March on recomendation and were certainly glad of it. After checking in to the helpful cheery receptionist and freshening up in our room we visited the stunning Vienna bar for a few early evening drinks, moving on to the Paris cocktail bar for dinner(an excellent menu) we both thouroughly enjoyed this. (especially the Duck Confit it was delightful) service was brilliant, swift and proffesional.
reviews.title: Go to Tigerlily

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I have just spent 2 nights - a Friday and a Saturday - at Le Monde hotel in Edinburgh and loved every minute of it.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Every room is themed like a city and we were given the Beijing room, which is classed as a 'Superior' room (the cheaper of the 3 room classes available). The room was very spacious with a lovely window seat and everything was perfect - everything was clean as you would expect but there was a touch of class about the place. The room was beautifully lit and decorated, and included a safe, plasma screen tv with sky sports, and a reasonably priced mini-bar
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Above the bed there was a long horizontal window through to the shower room, but if you're not so keen on that there is a wee cord beside the bath that you can pull and make the glass frosted. The bath was lovely and big and included a rainfall shower. It really was luxury
reviews.title: Downtown New York!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a very busy, public bar/restaurant/club attached, though we never heard any noise in our room from the club, even though we were there over a weekend and when we arrived back at the hotel for a drink (around midnight) the queue outside was huge and pretty noisy.
reviews.title: Absolutely lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and attentive and I couldnt speak highly enough of them. They catered for everything and were happy to give advice regarding directions, local attractions etc.
reviews.title: Loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came to Edinburgh for the weekend and chose to stay at Le Monde because of its city centre location.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!!
if you want to sleep dont stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everthing and everyone from the staff, to the service to the room were excellent.
reviews.title: Great room with a few minor faults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our friends booked and paid for us 1 night in this hotel for part of our honeymoon. It was fab and i cant wait to go back. The whole experience was magical. We were origionally booked in the rio room which was lovely..perhaps a little small but still really nice. After spending a couple of hours in there we discovered the tv in the bath didnt work..this was not a major problem but we reported it to reception anyway.Within minutes the manager was at our door offering to transfer us to the la suite..which was just fantastic!! We totally loved the la suite and would reccomend it to anyone,, the bathroom is fantastic in there and the room is perfect,,,it follows the la theme to the t right up to th cd in the cd player being hotel california by the eagles!
reviews.title: Honeymoon In LA( Via Rio)

likes.liked: — The fact everything was so well designed and themed and you didt have to leave the hotel everythinh was there!
likes.disliked: — Haggis on breakfast..but thats personal taste...and we were in scotland!

reviews.text: The paris bar is lovely and the service is first class,,we had some lovely cocktails that the bar man chose for us! We ate in the paris restuarant which was really nice and the food was superb and very good value for money,,,3 courses for two people for less than £50!! The breakfast was also very good,,we missed the buffet breakfast but were still served a lovely hot breakfast which we orderd from a menu..which had something for everyone.
reviews.title: Trendy Edinburgh
Not Good!!
reviews.text: All in all we really enjoyed our stay at Le monde and we WILL be going back. I would realy recommend spending the extra cash and getting a suite rather than a room,,its a much better experience of the theme !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Le Monde with friends.
reviews.title: Unique!!

likes.liked: — That the hotel was not just an ordinary boring hotel with pain rooms tht have nothing but a bed and toilet.
likes.disliked: — The room could have been slightly bigger but dont let that put you off.

reviews.text: Tokyo Suite and Rio.... The rooms were good, a little bit tired in places but in the main good.
reviews.title: Fabulous City Trip

likes.liked: — Comfy bed, plasma screen TVs, Huge bathroom, rainfall shower

description: Voted the 8th trendiest hotel in the UK, we are without a doubt the trendiest hotel on George Street, and one of only three to make the shortlist in Edinburgh. Wander through a unique odyssey of world class eating, drinking and dreaming... without even leaving Edinburgh. Our 18 individually designed rooms are inspired by some of the world's most exciting cities.
